lines.text: I have but one life to give to adventure.
If you're half as brave as you talk, you'll have the courage to unmask!
We'll see if YOU have the courage to die!
Have you been doing battle with the spirits of the Enchanted Forest?

[trying to catch his breath]
That... that must be it.
I take it that Merlin has caused you a little trouble.
Not half the trouble I'll cause you if you don't take me to King Arthur!
Your threat is my command.
[Galahad and Bors meet a peddler whose mule refuses to budge]
Greetings. What manner of beast is this that stays fixed to the ground?
His mother was a goat... his father a turtle...

[to Arthur]
Your 'traitor,' young Galahad, is fighting your battle quite shrewdly, Sire.
He's fighting for his own kin.
You dare to challenge Excalibur?
I not only dare... I must!
Whoa. Galahad, I have an uncanny chill coursing up and down my spine. Have you never heard it said that rashness is the father of disaster?
True... but too much caution is the blood brother of cowardice.
Doubtless you think it's an easy matter to find that outlaw camp.
One more "doubtless" out of you and I'll *doubtless* crack you right on your thick...
What's your pleasure, gentlemen?
We had hoped to toast the health of Bartog and Cawker, but they don't seem to be here.
How could you, with them in the back room making great plans.
Some of those plans concern me. I've been made a captain on account of the attack on Camelot.
They were talking of Camelot true enough, when I last took a round of drinks.

[placing a coin in her hand]
Give them another round. Say it's from two of their most loyal men.
[Bors also takes her hand and gives her another coin]
What's the extra one for?
That's to leave the door open when you come out. We'd like to hear the good news.
Who are the two men you're serving? They have a familiar look...
No doubt they should, since they're a couple of Cawker's men. They're buying drinks to gain his favor.
They gave you an extra gold piece because they like your smile?
Is there something wrong with it?
Arthur's sword - the true Excalibur - will be at the Ram's Head Inn this noon, but I'll need help to recover it.
No doubt you will, but you've come to the wrong place. Who here will believe you?
You will.
I can get you safely beyond the walls. We'll use the secret passageway.
Is it guarded?
Certainly - by me!
Now there's nothing to stop the Black Knight from rallying the outlaws, joining with Ulric and storming Camelot!
Except us.
Put yourself in The Black Knight's place. Where would you go?
Home and lie down. I'm tired.
A favor... I beg of you!
You have only to ask - and I shall refuse
A little water... I perish of thirst!
Good! Then perish! It will save stretching a good rope.
